column4: is anyone finding that they cannot access shared folders/files from a 10.04 system from their 10.10 system ?
my two 10.10 machines can access each other' shares but cannot access the shares on the 10.04 system
I'd try to go via command line route and to find out what error messages is it outputting
for starters there's smbtree which will enum. smb shares and to see if its visible, and then there's stuff like smbmount
I can also see the folder in nautilus
so ok maybe its a mounting issue
just give it a go, if its wrong correct it and try again
mount.cifs: permission denied: no match for /mnt/Zonbu-Videos found in /etc/fstab
why is this messing with fstab?
its looking for alias within /etc/fstab, but the output seems skewed
this was the command I ended up doing after creating the folder "Zonbu-Videos" under /mnt ....  smbmount smb://zeth-zonbu/video /mnt/Zonbu-Videos -o rw
there's also this site yo might want to have a read: http://tldp.org/HOWTO/SMB-HOWTO-8.html
